description.narrative:
Project Outcomes: - Stakeholders - Access to growth capital for Fund investees: The Fund will provide access to growth capital by investing between US$30-200 million in at least five companies across Africa. - Stakeholders - Increased investee growth: The Fund is expected to add value to its investee companies through a focus on operational value-add in four main areas: (a) leadership and organization; (b) strategy and execution; (c) operational excellence; and (d) governance.
Contribution to Market Creation: - Competitiveness: The Project is expected to increase competitive pressures within the African PE market by demonstrating the viability of PE investments in a region which is suffering from a lack of investor confidence.

The proposed project consists of an equity investment of US$50 million in Helios Investors IV, L.P. (Helios IV or the Fund), a Cayman Islands exempted limited partnership targeting US$1.25 billion in third-party commitments. The Funds investment strategy is to make mid-to-large cap growth equity investments for significant minority and control positions in market-leading, diversified platform companies in Africa.
